details.title: Punjab extends lockdown till may 31 but curfew to end on May 18
details.content:
From 18th May, curfew will be lifted in Punjab; however, lockdown will be implemented till May 31st. Punjab will follow the strategy of containment and non-containment zones wherein only the affected areas will be sealed. Details will be shared by DCs. (1/2) pic.twitter.com/EHU5UMgG5U

— Capt.Amarinder Singh (@capt_amarinder) May 16, 2020

details.content: (Photo | Shekhar Yadav, EPS)

details.title: OPINION | Criticism cannot be sedition
details.content:
Two things worry me. Deeply. Feeling patriotic, I sat glued to the television set for the Prime Minister’s “address to the nation.” After two minutes I felt hungry and moved to the dining table. Like me, the majority of people in the south must have lost interest in the Hindi prabhashan. I don’t feel good about my lack of interest in Hindi. But I don’t feel guilty either....' writes TJS George.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Prayagraj: Teachers follow social distancing while checking Board exams papers

details.title: Two Chennai ration shop employees test positive in Nagapattinam, tally reaches 50

details.title: COLUMN | What we have already lost as nation and society
details.content: 'Long after the coronavirus has been vanquished or vanishes by itself, heated debates will rage and laments will continue about devastation and loss caused by it. It is impossible to share the grief of those who have lost their near and dear ones in the pandemic but it is not so difficult to focus on what we have already lost—maybe forever—as a nation and society during the lockdown....' writes Pushpesh Pant. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: WATCH | Trump unveils 'Operation Warp Speed', predicts COVID-19 vaccine by end of year
Migrant workers in Punjab crosses rivers on foot to get home
details.content:
Since inter-state borders are sealed and no movement is allowed without permission from authorities, many workers are risking their lives by crossing rivers. Sources said that in the last few days, the migrants have been crossing into Shamli and Saharanpur districts in Uttar Pradesh from various places in Yamunagar, Karnal and Panipat districts of Haryana.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: EXPRESS INTERVIEW | Rise in COVID-19 cases because of intensive testing: Gujarat CM Vijay Rupani
details.content:
'The rise in COVID-19 cases is due to high number of tests performed by our health offic i a l s. Talking about Ahmedabad, more than 60% of the total cases have originated from cluster regions… Initially, we identified the hotspot areas and imposed curfew. At the same time, we ensured aggressive testing in those areas...' says CM Rupani.

— T Muruganandham (@muruga_TNIE) May 17, 2020

details.title: Lockdown relaxations in Tamil Nadu
details.content:
• Theatres, bars, gyms, beach, tourist spots, zoological parks, museums, swimming pools, sports stadia, big auditoriums, conference halls will also remain closed till May 31.
  • Schools, colleges, training centres, research institutions and all educational institutions, will remain closed till May 31; bar on public darshan in places of worship will continue; all religious gatherings are also barred.
  • There won't be any fresh relaxations in 12 districts - Chennai, Kancheepuram, Thiruvallur, Chengalpattu, Villupuram, Cuddalore, Ranipet, Tiruapathur, Kallakurichi, Tiruvannmalai, Ariyalur and Perambalur.
  • Public and private transport is allowed within the district in 25 districts without TN e-Pass : Coimbatore, Salem, Erode, Tiruppur, Namakkal, Karur, Tirunelveli, Thoothukudi, Tenkasi, Kanyakumari, Theni, Madurai, Sivaganga, Virudhunagar, Ramanathapuram, Dindigul, Pudukottai, Trichy, Tiruvarur, Thanjavur, Nagappattinam, Dharmapuri, Krishnagiri, Vellore and Nilgiris.
  • Commercial establishments which have been closed during lockdown can function only for maintenance purpose with minimum number of workers; answersheet valuation works for Plus Two examinations are exempted.
  • In the 12 districts where public transport is not allowed, permission is given to taxi and autorickshaws for medical purposes alone with TN e-Pass.
  • Under the MGNREGA scheme, instead of 50 percent workers, hereafter 100 percent workers can be involved.

All officers have been directed to ensure that migrants do not face any kind of problem. Trains will be arranged for them as per the need: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal pic.twitter.com/4mkKYL62TH

— ANI (@ANI) May 17, 2020

details.title: 'Amend sectopm 86 of Civil Procedure code'
details.content: All India Bar Association writes to PM Narendra Modi to amend Section 86 of the Civil Procedure Code, which restricts scope of a citizen to sue a foreign government, enabling filing of lawsuits against China to seek damages for COVID19 pandemic.

details.title: Six more test positive in Hassan district of Karnataka
details.content: With six more cases reported on Sunday, tally went up to 26 in Hassan district of Karnataka. The patients have a travel history from Mumbai. Until now, five cases were reported on May 12, four on May 13, seven on May 13 adnd 14, five on May 16 and 17. District Collector R Girish said that all the 26 positive patients returned from Mumbai and are institutionally quarantined immediately after they arrived at the checkpost near Channarayapatna. Among today's cases, three are from Alur, two from Channarayapatna and one from Holenasaripur. Sources said that the district might witness a rise in the infetion rate soon.

Union Ministry of Home Affairs issues detailed guidelines for extended lockdown till May 31 Part Two @xpresstn @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/dF976Pu0xR

— T Muruganandham (@muruga_TNIE) May 17, 2020

details.title: MHA issues new guidelines for lockdown 4.0
details.content:
• Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) issues guidelines on measures to be taken by Ministries/Departments of Government of India, State Governments/UT Governments & State/UT authorities for containment of COVID19. Lockdown4 will remain in effect till 31st May 2020.
  • The delineation of red, green, and orange zones will be decided by the respective State/Union Territory governments, after taking into consideration the parameters shared by the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare.
  • All domestic and international air travel of passengers, except for domestic medical services, domestic air ambulance and for security purposes or purposes as permitted by Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) to remain prohibited throughout the country.
  • All cinema halls, shopping malls, gymnasiums, swimming pools, entertainment parks, theatres, bars and auditoriums, assembly halls and similar places, shall continue to remain closed throughout the country till 31st May
  • Sports complexes and stadia will be permitted to open; however, spectators will not be allowed
  • With a view to ensuring safety in offices and workplaces, employers on best effort basis should ensure that Arogya Setu is installed by all employees having compatible mobile phones. District authorities have been asked to advise individuals to install the Aarogya Setu application on compatible mobile phones & regularly update their health status on the app. This will facilitate timely provision of medical attention to those individuals who are at risk.
  • All other activities will be permitted except those which are specifically prohibited under these guidelines. However, in containment zones, only essential activities shall be allowed, as mentioned earlier.
  • State/UT Governments shall not dilute the lockdown guidelines issued under the Disaster Management Act 2005, in any manner
  • During the extended lockdown till 31st May, the night curfew shall continue to remain in force on the movement of individuals, for all non-essential activities, between 7 pm and 7 am
  • Persons above 65 years of age, persons with co-morbidities, pregnant women, and children below the age of 10 years, shall stay at home till 31st May, except for essential and health purposes

details.title: Vidyut Jammwal praises Dehradun fireman for 'Operation Sanjivni'

Those getting injured during the travel back will get Rs 25,000 as well as free treatment, the CM said. (READ MORE)

details.title: Bihar reports eighth death due to COVID-19, cases climb to 1,251
details.content: A 55-year-old diabetic migrant worker, who fell ill upon return to Bihar from Mumbai and died before his sample was collected, tested positive for coronavirus, and is the state's eighth COVID-19 fatality.

details.title: BCCI on skill-based training camp
details.content: Taking into account the restrictions on air travel and movement of people till 31st May, the BCCI will wait further before organizing a skill-based training camp for its contracted players: Board of Control for Cricket in India

details.title: Mumbai COVID-19 tally nears 20,000; Pune count crosses 4,000-mark
details.content:
Mumbai on Sunday reported 1,571 COVID-19 cases, of which 44 are from Dharavi slum area, taking the number of patients here to 19,967 so far, a Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) official said.
Meanwhile, with 223 new detections, the number of COVID-19 cases in Pune mounted to 4,018.

details.title: Five Assamese migrant workers miss train after Chennai police insist on Aadhaar
details.content: As if the migrant workers were not facing enough problems, the Chennai police held some of them back from travelling to Assam. Reason? They did not have Aadhaar. Though Aadhaar card is not mandatory for migrants to travel back home, Chennai police seems to be insisting on it for some reason. (READ MORE)

details.title: India joins 62 other nations in seeking probe into WHO's COVID-19 response
details.content: The draft calls for "impartial, independent and comprehensive" probe into the coronavirus crisis. Besides, an inquiry into the actions of the World Health Organization (WHO) and "their timelines pertaining to the COVID-19 pandemic."

details.title: No end to their miseries
details.content:
Delhi: Migrant workers were seen at Delhi-Ghazipur (UP) border. One of them, Rajkumari, who belongs to Sitapur, UP says,"When lockdown is not ending&Govt is not facilitating our travel, we've no option but to walk. If we die here,our mortal remains will also not reach our homes". pic.twitter.com/bJSFkSR2ZI

— ANI (@ANI) May 17, 2020

details.title: Lockdown 4.0: Here's what's allowed, what's not

We've been sitting here since 6 AM. If there are not enough buses, then let us walk home." pic.twitter.com/W0MZKGKW64

details.title: Will help every migrant living in Delhi, says CM Kejriwal
details.content: “We take the responsibility of each and every migrant labourer living in Delhi. If they want to stay in Delhi, we will take care of them and if they want to return to their villages, then we are arranging trains for them. Under no circumstances we will leave them destitute,” Kejriwal tweeted. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

We want to go home,” said a migrant worker sitting on the road.

Nearly 100 migrant workers gathered on a busy road connecting IIM Ahmedabad with Vastrapur area here on Monday and hurled stones at police and vehicles passing by while demanding that they be sent back to their native places immediately, officials said. Police later lobbed teargas shells to disperse the rioters and detained nearly 100 suspects.

details.title: Six workers at Oppo's factory in Noida tested positive for COVID-19; company suspends operation
details.content: Chinese smartphone maker Oppo has suspended operations at Noida factory after its six workers were found to be infected by coronavirus, a senior Gautam Budh Nagar police officer confirmed on Monday. The company had resumed operations on Friday with screening of all employees who were asked to join the work. Based on the information available with the Gautam Budh (GB) Nagar  police, the officer told PTI that six workers at the Noida plant of Oppo have been tested COVID-19 positive.

details.title: Karnataka SSLC exams to be held from June 25 to July 4, PUC paper on June 18
details.content: The SSLC examinations in Karnataka will be held from June 25 to July 4, said Minister of Primary and Secondary Education Suresh Kumar. Papers such as English, maths, science and social science will have a day's gap each, hence the 10-day duration. The lone pending second PUC exam -- English -- will be held on June 18.

details.title: West Bengal government extends COVID-19 lockdown till May 31
details.content:
West Bengal government extends COVID-19 lockdown till May 31. Announcing this, CM Mamata Banerjee informed that her government will try to arrange 115 more trains in the next few days the cost for which will be borne by the state. 

  • The Centre has asked us to impose curfew from 7 pm to 7 am. But we will anyway be in lockdown so I don’t want to impose the 'curfew' word on people. I urge everyone to follow norms. We will not implement any curfew. Lockdown will continue.
  • Private offices,even those inside shopping malls,can work with up to 50% staff.Inter-district buses will be allowed from May 21. Auto-rickshaws can operate from May 27 with 2 ppl. Beauty parlours&salons can open but all equipment must be sanitised.

details.title: Kerala govt relaxations in lockdown 4.0
details.content:
• Shopping complexes in Kerala can open with 50% shops on rotational basis. Barber shops and beauty parlours to open without air conditioning, only hair cutting & shaving service allowed.
  • State run liquor shops BEVCO to open after the online system gets ready. Bars can sell liquor only as takeaway from counters. Clubs can sell food and liquor as parcel for members.
  • Police Special Task Force will be constituted to oversee the use of masks. 1344 booked for not using masks across the state

details.title: Pointers from Delhi CM's presser
details.content:
• 10,054 cases have been reported in Delhi till date. 4,485 persons have been cured/discharged and 160 people have died due to COVID-19 till now.
  • Barber shops, spas and saloons to remain closed for now. Stepping out of homes between 7 pm to 7 am, except for essential services will be prohibited. Taxis & cabs will be allowed but only 2 passengers at a time in a car.
  • Private offices can open at full strength but they should try that most of the staff works from home. Markets can open but shops will open on odd-even basis. Sports complexes & stadia can open but without spectators.
  • Construction activities are allowed in the national capital now but only with labourers who are in Delhi right now
  • Buses are allowed to run but with only 20 passengers at a time. Passengers will be screened before he/she boards the bus. Transport Dept will ensure that social distancing norms are followed at all bus-stops and inside the bus.
  • Carpooling or car-sharing will not be allowed for aggregators. Auto-rickshaws, e-rickshaws & cycle-rickshaws will be allowed but only with 1 passenger. For two-wheelers, pillion rider will not be allowed. There will be no activity allowed in containment zones

A migrant labourer breaks down hearing the demise of his relative over the phone in Hyderabad.

details.title: WATCH | Hundreds of migrants gather at Ghaziabad ground in UP for train travel
Mumbai civic body mulling 'Kerala model' to contain coronavirus in Dharavi
details.content:
The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to implement the 'Kerala model' to contain coronavirus in Dharavi, the largest slum in Asia which has turned a COVID-19 epicentre with 1300 patients and 57 deaths so far. The 'Kerala model', sources said, is likely to help the authorities to isolate all suspected people and do contract tracing effectively. With 15 lakh people living in 550 acre of area, Dharavi is one of the most densely-populated areas in Mumbai.

FULL REPORT HERE

details.title: TN government's relief camps near Andhra border curtail movement of desperate migrant workers
details.content: The movement of desperate migrant workers trudging or cycling from Tamil Nadu to Andhra Pradesh has nearly stopped after Chief Minister Edappadi K Palaniswami appealed to them not to leave for their home states on their own as the state is taking steps to send back at least 10,000 people every day. details.title: Telangana CM KCR condemns dictatorial attitude of centre
details.content: We are condemning the dictatorial attitude of the centre. The centre says it would give funds to the states only when they honour its directives. How can this be acceptable?: Telangana CM KCR

details.title: ICC Cricket Committee recommends prohibition of saliva to shine the ball
details.content: The ICC Cricket Committee recommends the prohibition of saliva to shine the ball. Anil Kumble-led panel also recommends non-neutral match officials for all international matches: International Cricket Council

details.title: Lockdown relaxation: Resumption of public transport, more shops allowed to open in Chandigarh
details.content: Chandigarh administration on Monday announced resumption of public transport services and allowed opening of more shops. However, movement of people shall remain strictly prohibited between 7 and 7 am except for essential activities. (MORE DETAILS HERE)

details.title: Maharashtra crosses 35,000 COVID-19 cases mark
details.content: Meanwhile, state capital Mumbai reported 1,185 fresh COVID-19 cases and 23 more deaths, taking the total case count to 21,152 and the fatalities to 757, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said.

details.title: The nationwide tally of COVID-19 cases crossed one lakh
details.content: The nationwide tally of COVID-19 cases crossed one lakh on Monday with more people testing positive for the deadly virus in Maharashtra, Gujarat, Tamil Nadu and other states, even as a much-relaxed fourth phase of the lockdown began with restarting of market complexes, autos, taxis and inter-state buses in various parts of the country. (READ MORE)

details.title: Lockdown blessing in disguise for poverty-ridden community in Maharashtra
details.content: The COVID-19 and the strict measures taken by the administration has become a blessing in disguise for poverty-ridden farmers and other community who spends a huge amount of money on their children marriages and other social functions. (READ MORE)

details.title: Government doctor, postnatal mother among 13 COVID-19 patients discharged in Tamil Nadu's Ranipet
details.content: Thirteen COVID-19 patients, including a government doctor, a pharmacist and a postnatal mother, were discharged, after getting cured of the infection, from Govt District Headquarters Hospital at Wallajapet in Ranipet district on Monday. (READ MORE)

details.title: 28 Zee Media employees test positive for COVID-19, office sealed
details.content: Zee Media said on Monday that 28 employees have tested positive for Covid-19 and its office, newsroom and studios here have been sealed. (READ MORE)

details.title: Kerala lockdown relaxation: Buses, taxis, autos to ply; malls to remain shut
details.content: In a relief to the tipplers, Kerala government also announced that liquor outlets would be opened when an online system for booking liquor is ready. (CLICK HERE FOR MORE DETAILS)

details.title: Odd-Even traffic rule to be imposed in selected cities in Uttarakhand
details.content: Announcing guidelines of lockdown 4.0, Uttarakhand chief secretary Utpal Kumar Singh said odd-even system of traffic will be initiated in selected cities of the state. (READ MORE)

details.title: Bihar reports ninth COVID-19 death; total cases rise to 1,423
details.content: Bihar on Monday reported its ninth COVID-19 fatality while 103 people tested positive for coronavirus, taking the total number of cases in the state to 1,423. (READ MORE)

details.title: Only red and green zones in Madhya Pradesh during lockdown 4.0
details.content: According to Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan, the entire state has been divided into two zones – Red and Green Zone. (READ MORE)
